crypto.name: RICH-CLUB
crypto.desc:
Can you please get me an invitation to this club ? It looks pretty cool.

address: 0xC7bEc01281648D3A7F9BB86B811A2de5B1E0cc61

crypto.name: crackme.sol
crypto.desc:
the fact that everything can be turned into a crackme is so cool

address: 0xDb2F21c03Efb692b65feE7c4B5D7614531DC45BE

crypto.name: crypto-casino
crypto.desc:
there's is cool decentralized casino, you can play as much as you want but if you lose once you lost everything

address : 0x186d5d064545f6211dD1B5286aB2Bc755dfF2F59

crypto.name: sanity-check
crypto.desc:
aren't you tired of the lame read the rules flag ?

that's why over at this CTF the flag is on the blockchain over at this address 0x5CDd53b4dFe8AE92d73F40894C67c1a6da82032d

crypto.name: secure-enclave
crypto.desc:
I just found this dope smart contract, you just give it a secret and it hides it on the ethereum network.

address: 0x9B0780E30442df1A00C6de19237a43d4404C5237

pwn.name: Babyheap
pwn.desc: You can never get away from these pesky baby challenges. So I thought, if you can't beat them, join them!

pwn.name: echo
pwn.desc: tell me something to say it back

pwn.name: faking till you are making
pwn.desc: Upon investigating some malicous blockchain workings, we found out a binary was being exploited to money launder. We took a look at it, and found a note by the author of the binary saying something about "maleficarum". Any clue what that is?

pwn.name: moving-signals
pwn.desc: We don't like giving binaries that contain loads of information, so we decided that a small program should do for this challenge. Even written in some custom assembly. I wonder how this could be exploited.

pwn.name: ret-of-the-rops
pwn.desc: Is ROP dead? God no. But it returns from a long awaited time, this time in a weird fashion. Three instructions ... can you pwn it?

pwn.name: the pwn inn
pwn.desc: As we know that crypto is a hot potato right now, we wanted to welcome you to a safe place, The Pwn Inn. We've had many famous faces stay in our Inn, with gets() and printf() rating us 5 stars. We've decided to start making an app, and wanted you guys to be our beta testers! Welcome!

rev.name: Backupkeys
rev.desc: Can you recover my backup keys to get the flag , they probably are hardcoded ?

rev.name: Cage
rev.desc: Are you aware of the scopes yet?

rev.name: Ware
rev.desc: My plaintext has been encrypted by an innocent friend of mine while playing around cryptographic libraries, can you help me to recover the plaintext , remembers it's just numbers and there's a space between some numbers which you need to remove the space and submit the recovered plain text as a flag.

rev.name: WrongDownload
rev.desc: My key has been missing inside these two binaries can you help me to find it out ,as per my friend the key is divided in two parts between the two binaries so, remember you need to join them up before submitting as a flag.

rev.name: battleroad
rev.desc:
I have something special hidden over there. The battle is to get to key amidst the xored hurtles, the 42 chars wish you luck.

Hint : Trust the XOR. Hint2: the flag isn't the address it's a private key for an ethereum account , you need to do something to know what the address you got does

rev.name: cliBrowser
rev.desc:
Man I am so tired of that cringe web stack, it's such a joke

So I made my web app in the cli, because what's better than fancy terminal

rev.name: hash
rev.desc:
I received a corrupted program the keys are probably lost within the game can you just find it for me to get the flag?.

Flag format : flag{key1+key2}
